metadata.title: Subway Station Entrances, New York NY, May 2016
metadata.creator: Janine Billadello
Anastasia Clark
metadata.subject: structure
transportation
metadata.description: This point layer represents MTA New York City Transit subway station entrances. Each point represents a physical entryway or exit from a subway station to a street or building. Several attributes describe the physical details of the entrance (whether they have stairs, escalators, elevators, etc) and the station. This layer does not include the Staten Island Railway stations. The features do not have a unique identifier. This layer was created by the GIS Lab at Baruch College CUNY as part of the NYC Mass Transit Spatial Layer series, to provide access to mass transit features for basic geographic analysis and map making. The data was generated from the MTA's static data developer feeds. It was transformed and generalized from a GTFS format into readily usable GIS features using a series of python scripts.
metadata.source: Metropolitan Transportation Authority, Static Data Feeds
metadata.coverage: New York City, New York, United States
